result.execSummary:
The defendant Maxwell A. Decker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any counseling as directed by agent

Shall have no contact or communication with victim; Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

ADDRESS INFO for Maxwell A. Decker
Current: P.O. Box 700, c/o DCI, Waupun, WI 53963 United States  (Effective: 01-13-2016)
Prior: 216 W Center St, c/o Dodge County Jail, Juneau, WI 53039 United States

Called 14CF263 and 15CF58. Defendant Maxwell A. Decker in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer (for 14CF263) and Attorney Jessica Moller (for 15CF58).  Yolanda J. Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court heard on charges Def. will plead to. Atty Tienstra heard on PSI that was brought to her attention just prior to this hearing, request delay to read PSI or take plea today and reschedule sentencing.  Atty Mayer heard. Atty Moller heard. Ct. heard, will not make determination w/o a PSI, will take plea today and reschedule sentencing. Court questions Def., who is ready to move forward today w/ plea. Court finds victim rights compliance. Court heard, reviews charges and penalties in both cases. Def. pleads NC to cts. 1 and 3 in 14CF263, and NC to ct. 1 in 15CF58. Court heard, reviews PQ&WOR, reviews rights, finds factual basis, finds pleas are made FVK&I, accepts pleas and finds Def. guilty of above three counts. Remainder of counts are DRI (cts. 2, 4, 5 and 6). Court orders PSI w/i 60 days. Court goes off record to schedule sentencing hearing. Back on record, same appearances. Order to state - presentence to be completed asap and that there is also a Green Lake PSI.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Discussion held; defendant does not contest Dr. Schoenecker's report finding def competent to proceed; Court finds def competent; matters to be set for further hearing;  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.

14CF263, 15CF58Defendant Maxwell A. Decker in court, in custody with attorney William Andrew Mayer and Atty Jessica Moeller.   Attorney Yolanda Tienstra appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Mayer heard, raises competency, Atty Moeller concurs, Atty Moeller raised competency in the 15CF58 case on Monday, court orders competency evaluations at this time on both cases.  Atty Mayer heard, court denies bond motion.
Defendant shall have his/her fingerprints and photographs taken at the Dodge County Sheriff's Department, Jail Division.
